abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Second Poverty
            Reduction Support Credit and Grant for Tanzania was
            satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory.
            Findings and implications: A stable political environment
            contributed to the continuing successful implementation of
            macroeconomic and structural reforms in Tanzania.
            Development and implementation of a common performance
            assessment framework and a joint review process, which
            harmonizes general budget support of 12 donors, is a major
            achievement. Weaknesses in government process such as the
            poverty monitoring system or the budget system impact
            directly on the ability of the Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit program to present adequate results orientation and
            monitoring frameworks.
